Package org.blockchainnative.annotations

Annotation Type ContractEvent

  • @Retention(RUNTIME)
@Target(METHOD)
public @interface ContractEvent
    Declares a method to be mapped the corresponding event of a smart contract.

    Depending on the blockchain in use, a smart contract event (if events are supported at all) can consist one or multiple values.
    In order to function correctly, a method annotated with ContractEvent must obey to the following rules:
    • The event method needs to return Observable
    • An non-generic event type needs to be specified which contains a field for each value in the corresponding event.
    • The Observable's generic parameter is either directly the event type or the event type wrapped in Event
    • Event methods can accept parameters, however all of them are considered to be special arguments that need to be interpreted by the underlying provider (see EventParameter)


    The following need to be considered about event types:
    • The type needs to define a public parameterless constructor.
    • The event type's fields are either assigned through their setters if possible, or directly via reflection.

    Consider the following example of an event with argument, both methods are valid to be used ContractEvent: 
     
 public interface EventSample {

      Observable<HelloEvent> onHelloEvent();

      Observable<Event<HelloEvent>> onHelloEventWrapped();

      class HelloEvent {
          public String greeter;
      }
 }
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    ContractWrapperGenerator, Event

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element Description
      java.lang.String value
      Explicitly specifies the name of the event in the associated smart contract.

    • Element Detail

      • value

        java.lang.String value
        Explicitly specifies the name of the event in the associated smart contract. If no name is specified (i.e. an empty string) the name of the method to which this annotation is applied is used.
        Returns:
        name of the event in the associated smart contract.
        Default:
        ""
